ygData.subject: Re: Chain and Binding
ygData.msgSnippet: ... How do these guys /con to you?  One of the reasons I test this on low greens is because mobs closer to your level have a greater chance of breaking out of
ygData.messageBody:
On Fri, 10 Sep 1999, Bard wrote:
>
> That's odd. I got it last night, and it semed to stack with Binding. I
> don't have any hard numbers, but I was fighting 2 of the bandits (Brennon
> and Truk) in the cave just across from Highpass Keep, and used both during
> the fight. At first I used it on Truk, and noticed that Brennon swung more
> often, then I switched to fighting Brennon and noticed that Truk was now
> swinging at me more. (Neither were equipped with weapons :o/ ) I'll try
> it again tonight just to make sure that my eyes weren't deceiving me

How do these guys /con to you? One of the reasons I test this
on low greens is because mobs closer to your level have a
greater chance of breaking out of the effect (you will become
intimately familiar with this when they break out of Chain at
the worst possible time). So it's possible (likely even
depending on /con) that when you switched to Chain, the one
you weren't Chaining broke out of Binding and was attacking at
normal speed, while the one you were Chaining was still slowed
down.

--
John H. Kim
kim@...
